bug.short_desc: [internal] Build a build environment compiler to warn on TypeBinding comparisons

long_desc.thetext:
BETA_JAVA8:
With the deep encoding of type annotations, most subsystems of the compiler should stop using == and != for binding comparisons and use TypeBinding.equalsEquals and its counterpart.
We need an automated way to catch these places. I propose that we build a special build environment compiler that would warn on type binding comparisons.
Once it is operational, we may want to allow a mechanism to tolerate == and != comparisons on specially tagged situations like the FALL-THROUGH tag for switch cases without breaks.
Shankha, please take a look.

(In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #0) > Once it is operational, we may want to allow a mechanism to tolerate == and > != comparisons on specially tagged situations like the FALL-THROUGH tag for > switch cases without breaks.
Sounds great (I already have a few candidates to be thus tagged). Perhaps $NON-NLS-1$ is an even better example, because it can be used on the same line "in the right margin".
Working on it.

Created attachment 235848 WIP: Patch
Some changes in place so as to build a compiler which can report warnings with respect to == and != on binding operations.
The changes still do not produce the warning. Debugging.
Thanks

Comments:
1. IProblem.WarningOnComaprisonOfTypes should be IProblem.InvalidIdentityComparison
2. BinaryExpression changes -> This is dead code since EqualsExpression overrides this method
3. NonIntrevenedType should be UninternedType
4. None of the changes to set this bit should be required except in both the constructors of TypeBinding. Every other subtype will chain to one of these constructors.
5. We can unconditionally issue the warning, No check of options is required.
6. Message could be:
The uninterned types {0} and {1} should not be compared using ==/!= operators.
Please do this before proceeding with further changes. Thanks!

(In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #5)
> 4. None of the changes to set this bit should be required except in both the > constructors of TypeBinding. Every other subtype will chain to one of these > constructors.
This is a broken scheme. Please set these bits in computeID() as I originally suggested. Setting this bit in the constructor of TB will make every *type* uninterned. For example, when we create a STB for class X found in the program, we will mark X as UninternedType - that is wrong.
What we want to is to mark (say) the STB that corresponds to STB to be UninternedType, not every STB we create - do you understand the distinction ? I got confused when you suggested the "simple" scheme and fell for it :) Sorry.

(In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #5)
> 5. We can unconditionally issue the warning, No check of options is required.
Since per comment#6, we are moving to the original scheme I proposed for tagging UninternedTypes in computeID, we will want to do this only when an undocumented option is enabled. This warning could be set in our preferences file.
Note: computeID is overridden in some cases. We need to make sure the version that computes the bits gets called in all TypeBinding hierarchy types and from all constructors.

I'm not closely following this, but if you feel that an approach based on TypeBinding.id is tricky, you may want to have a look at ReferenceBinding.typeBits and the corresponding constants in TypeIds like BitAutoCloseable but also InheritableBits. This could perhaps spare you from having to enumerate all relevant types, but work with a notion of "all subtypes of TypeBinding" e.g. Cheers.

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #8) > I'm not closely following this, but if you feel that an approach based on > TypeBinding.id is tricky, you may want to have a look at > ReferenceBinding.typeBits and the corresponding constants in TypeIds like > BitAutoCloseable but also InheritableBits. This could perhaps spare you from > having to enumerate all relevant types, but work with a notion of "all > subtypes of TypeBinding" e.g. Cheers.
Thank you. That should fit perfectly, Shankha, please take a look Stephan's suggestion.

Created attachment 236015 WIP: Patch
All the suggestions asked for in https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=417803#c5 Incorporated.
Thanks

Review comments:
1. BatchCompilerTest: problem.isnvalidIdentityComparison is misspelled.
2. A Micro-optimization would also be to first check the right operand. Many places we have if (typeBinding != null) or if (typeBinding == null) These are always valid comparisons. Checking the right first would mean we don't have to check the left - micro optimization, but nevertheless one that would kick in numerous places. (May be this is a nonissue, may be null comes out as BaseTypeBinding ?) 3. Get rid of the noise diff in ArrayBinding & TypeBinding. Before posting a patch, always verify that there are no noise changes. 4. We don't want to reserve a tag bit for this. Since typeBits mechanism allows inheritance. 5. We want the type bit set only if some option is in effect.

Created attachment 236267 Patch
1) The patch has been created for the master branch. 2) RunAllJDTCore tests are fine. The patch was tested on the BETA_JAVA8 branch. RunAllJava8 tests are fine. Once the option is switched on we do see errors related to comparison of TypeBinding and related types.
The way to test would be the following. This is written down as it will help someone to verify the option.
1) On the BETA_JAVA8 branch checkout org.eclipse.jdt.core/.settings/org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs add the line: org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.invalidIdentityComparison=enabled
2) Run a empty project through the run configurations. 3) In the empty project, perform the following steps: File -> import -> plugin development -> plugin & fragments -> next -> the active target platform -> import as projects with src folder Select eclipse.jdt.core and click add.
3) There are no specific test cases added. Is there a necessity? I can add a dummy test cases with class names STB etc. and perform comparison of object of those types.
Review comments and action taken: 1. BatchCompilerTest: problem.isnvalidIdentityComparison is misspelled. Corrected. " <option key=\"org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.invalidIdentityComparison\" value=\"disabled\"/>\n" +
2. A Micro-optimization would also be to first check the right operand. Many places we have if (typeBinding != null) or if (typeBinding == null) These are always valid comparisons. Checking the right first would mean we don't have to check the left - micro optimization, but nevertheless one that would kick in numerous places. (May be this is a nonissue, may be null comes out as BaseTypeBinding ?)
if (originalLeftType instanceof ReferenceBinding && originalRightType instanceof ReferenceBinding) { ReferenceBinding leftR = (ReferenceBinding) originalLeftType; ReferenceBinding rightR = (ReferenceBinding) originalRightType; if (scope.compilerOptions().enableInvalidIdentityComparison && rightR.hasTypeBit(TypeIds.BitUninternedType) && leftR.hasTypeBit(TypeIds.BitUninternedType)) { scope.problemReporter().invalidIdentityComparison(this, originalLeftType, originalRightType); } }
3. Get rid of the noise diff in ArrayBinding & TypeBinding. Before posting a patch, always verify that there are no noise changes.
They are not part of the patch.
4. We don't want to reserve a tag bit for this. Since typeBits mechanism allows inheritance.
We have the bits under TypeIDs.
5. We want the type bit set only if some option is in effect. I have handled it at the SourceTypeBinding level and not at the BinaryTypeBinding level STB: computeId(scope.compilerOptions().enableInvalidIdentityComparison);
6. Have the changes being invoked under a option. The option is enableInvalidIdentityComparison.
7. Have the javadoc for new equals API in CharOperation.java and change the third parameter to componentIndex. This has been implemented.
Thanks

Created attachment 236268 Patch
I had mispelt RawTypeBinding and ReferenceBinding in the earlier patch.

Created attachment 236292 Same patch with a bunch of simplifications
Shankha, this is an untested patch, please go over the changes I have made and let me know if you agree with them, if you agree, please run the tests and let me know the results so I can release.
Markus, would you like us to include org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ITypeBinding too in the scheme of things ? I don't think we compare them in JDT/Core.
"enableInvalidIdentityComparison" is not a good choice for the option. I changed it to complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison
Stephan, this looks like something that easily be converted into a general purpose feature through org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Uninterned ??

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=236292&action=diff Thanks Srikanth. For the patch. I had one question.
In org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/TypeBinding.java:
public boolean hasTypeBit(int bit) { return false; }
What was the need for this?
The number of errors encountered is 731 which is same as my code.
RunAllJava8Tests are fine. RunAllJDTCoreTests are fine
Thanks

Created attachment 236317 Error List generated by switching on the option org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.uninternedIdentityComparison=enabled
The list of errors generated by switching on the option org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.uninternedIdentityComparison=enabled
on BETA_JAVA8 branch
Thanks
(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #20) > Created attachment 236317 [details] I think only the first 100 errors got copied. I will update the list.

Created attachment 236319 Error List generated by switching on the option org.eclipse.jdt.core.compiler.problem.uninternedIdentityComparison=enabled
All the 730 errors listed.

(In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #17) > Stephan, this looks like something that easily be converted into a general > purpose feature through org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Uninterned ??
Excellent point. I just gave it a home of its own: bug 419136 (not to be resolved before ECE :) )

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #23) > (In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #17) > > Stephan, this looks like something that easily be converted into a general > > purpose feature through org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Uninterned ?? > > Excellent point. I just gave it a home of its own: bug 419136
Great, thanks
> (not to be resolved before ECE :) )
I think you meant to say not to be resolved before 400874 :)

(In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #24) > (In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #23) > > (not to be resolved before ECE :) ) > > I think you meant to say not to be resolved before 400874 :)
Making that distinction would require the capability to look into the future beyond that conference, but my current horizon is limit to these few coming weeks, currently :)
OTOH, current work in bug 400874 indicates that I will probably soon have another forced break until more details are specified, e.g., integration of unchecked conversions, I just found a var args problem, etc... not to speak of "18.5.4 More Specific Method Inference" ("This section must describe ..." and then nothing).

Created attachment 236473 WIP: Patch with the checks for type binding handed
Few errors are fixed. This is a WIP. I have included the compiler option change in org.eclipse.jdt.core/.settings/org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs
In final patch the changes to this file won't be there.
Thanks
We have conditional offer of support from the UI team. I have raised https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=419444
I see a commit on master that appears to be this fix. If so, can this bug be resolved already?

Created attachment 236523 Replace ==/!= with method calls.
500+ locations transformed in this patch.
Created attachment 236524 Early patch for warning suppression

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #28) > I see a commit on master that appears to be this fix. If so, can this bug be > resolved already?
We are still working on adding warning suppression capability using tags of the form //$IDENTITY-COMPARISON$.
Just to clarify:
(In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #29) > Created attachment 236523 [details] > Replace ==/!= with method calls. > > 500+ locations transformed in this patch.
This patch is on BETA_JAVA8 to remove the illegal/potentially problematic comparisons.
and
(In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #30) > Created attachment 236524 [details] > Early patch for warning suppression
This patch is for master for warning suppression. We should close this for M3 so that all JDT engineers can upgrade to M3 as their IDE.

Created attachment 236527 Addition of the IDENTITY-COMPARISON Tag
Addition of the IDENTITY-COMPARISON Tag to locations where we feel == and != comparisons for TypeBinding types should be allowed.
Thanks

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #32) > Created attachment 236527 [details] > Addition of the IDENTITY-COMPARISON Tag > > Addition of the IDENTITY-COMPARISON Tag to locations where we feel == and != > comparisons for TypeBinding types should be allowed. > > Thanks
The changes for the parser and scanner have still to be put in.
Thanks

Created attachment 236529 Addition of the IDENTITY-COMPARISON Tag
Few files were missing from the patch:
org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/ParameterizedMethodBinding.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/ParameterizedTypeBinding.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/TypeBinding.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/TypeSystem.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/TypeVariableBinding.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/UnresolvedReferenceBinding.java

Created attachment 236538 Addition of the IDENTITY-COMPARISON Tag
Sorry one file was missing:
org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/InferenceContext.java
Thanks

Created attachment 236839 WIP: Patch
This patch is based on patch https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=236524 ( Early patch for warning suppression )
Few changes in Scanner.java with respect to the option this.complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison have been taken out. Will integrate those changes once the patch works end to end as this is a option and currently consider it switched on.
The variable validIdentityComparisonLines is now being transferred from scanner to compilation unit as each compilation unit will have it's own tag and each one of them will have there own separate storage.
The issue with the compilation unit object is not carried from scanner to EqualExpression.java.
Thanks

Created attachment 236992 WIP: Patch
The patch correctly identifies all the ==/!= errors related to classes belonging to TypeBinding and handles IDENTITY_COMPARISON tags correctly.
Two issues remain:
1) The compiler crashes if we uncomment out the following at line : 1622 in Scanner.java if ((this.checkNonExternalizedStringLiterals /*|| this.complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison*/) &&
i.e. if ((this.checkNonExternalizedStringLiterals ||this.complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison) &&
If we comment it out everything works fine and we do report the errors correctly.
2) The compiler figures out all the IDENTITY_COMPARISON tags except: private boolean isPrototype() { return this == this.prototype; //$IDENTITY-COMPARISON$ } line: 1341 BinaryTypeBinding.java
The problem does not show up in problems view.
Thanks

Created attachment 237002 Patch
Patch to be applied on the master branch. I still have to run JDTCore tests. Will run and update the results.
The patch is complete and can be merged in. There are two issues still pending.
1) LineNo: 2583 // I tried putting a check for complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison. It is false. Ideally the processing should be under the option. } else if ((pos = CharOperation.indexOf(IDENTITY_COMPARISON_TAG, s, true, sourceStart, sourceEnd)) != -1) {
The operation should be under new scanner flag: complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison
The option is set correctly to true at Line No: 228 this.complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison = complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison;
In some instances of scanner creation a different call path is taken and the complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison is not true.
2) Line No: 1622 Scanner.java
if ((this.checkNonExternalizedStringLiterals /*|| this.complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison*/) &&
If we uncomment out the option this.complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison we get a NPE.
It is a result of the processing :
Line 2529 Scanner.java while (ScannerHelper.isWhitespace(this.source[position])) { position++; } I have to figure it out. 3) There are three more errors in BETA_JAVA8 code with respect to ==/!= checks. I will put it in a separate fix where for those.
4) In my opinion the for review few files could be skipped as they are picked from the patch https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=236524
Set of files changed: org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/CompilationUnitDeclaration.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/EqualExpression.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/ReferenceBinding.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/TypeConstants.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/Parser.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/Scanner.java
Set of files which are different: org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/EqualExpression.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/Parser.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/Scanner.java
Thanks

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #38) > Created attachment 237002 [details] > Patch >
These are the set of files picked up from the patch without any changes: > org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/ > CompilationUnitDeclaration.java > org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/ > EqualExpression.java > org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/ > ReferenceBinding.java > org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/ > TypeConstants.java > org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/ > Parser.java > org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/ > Scanner.java >
Set of files in my opinion which should be reviewed: > org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/ > EqualExpression.java > org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/ > Parser.java > org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/ > Scanner.java >

RunAllJDTCore results are fine.
Thanks

Created attachment 237157 Patch
New Patch. Please ignore: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=417803#c38 , https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=417803#c39
I will have all the details in one comment.
The patch detects all the errors on comparisons related to classes belonging to TypeBinding.
Set of files which need to be reviewed: org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/EqualExpression.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/Parser.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/Scanner.java org.eclipse.jdt.core/model/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/core/util/CommentRecorderParser.java
The set of files part of this patch and not part of the above list are same as https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=236524 ( Early patch for warning suppression ).
The patch is complete in itself. There are two things which need to be checked.
1) In org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/EqualExpression.java
A new constructor has been added. public EqualExpression(Expression left, Expression right,int operator, int lineNo) { super(left,right,operator); this.lineNo = lineNo - 1; }
The original constructor has been called from 3 places. Only one of the calls was changed to the new constructor. I have not investigated if the old constructor (OC) should be replaced with the new constructor (NC).
I tested the code and replacing the OC with the NC where the OC was called did not lead to any new errors.
I did not change all the calls as there were no additional errors reported and having the extra parameter would increase the compile time.
2) Line No: 1644 org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/parser/Scanner.java
if ((this.checkNonExternalizedStringLiterals /*|| this.complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison*/) &&
If we uncomment out the option this.complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison we get a NPE.
It is a result of the processing :
Line 2551 Scanner.java while (ScannerHelper.isWhitespace(this.source[position])) { position++; }
The reason is parseTags was always called if the option this.checkNonExternalizedStringLiterals.
The option is switched off and on at various places. The assumption seems to be this function would not be called without this.checkNonExternalizedStringLiterals being on. We have a second option this.complainOnUninternedIdentityComparison which can also lead to parseTags being called.
Thanks
Fix and tests released here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=531d1e64d23aeb6d2b637e206fcbdf2c2d6b6bc5.

Created attachment 237349 Patch: (BETA_JAVA8) Add identity comparison matches and switch the flag for comparison on
Switch the identity comparison flag on and add the identity comparison flag for few other locations where errors were reported.
Thanks

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #43) > Created attachment 237349 [details] > Patch: (BETA_JAVA8) Add identity comparison matches and switch the flag for > comparison on > > Switch the identity comparison flag on and add the identity comparison flag > for few other locations where errors were reported.
Thanks, I'll take a look at this and absorb this once this ER is cherry picked onto Java 8.

I think we should consider :
should not be compared using == or != operators instead of should not be compared using ==/!= operators
The present form is not easy to understand, besides that fact that '/' itself is an operator.

Created attachment 238237 Patch for Comment 45
Patch for Comment 41.

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #46)
> Patch for Comment 41 Sorry for Commnent 45.

Verified for 4.4 M4 with build I20131210-2000.
But I would still like to discuss the message (comment #45) before merging into JAVA8.
